intro: Cayaponia ulei var. subtrilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
